Provision.Text: Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Secretary of State for External Affairs, pursuant to section 6 of the Export and Import Permits Act, is pleased hereby to revoke the Export Control List, C.R.C., c. 601, and, pursuant to section 3* of that Act, to establish the annexed Export Control List in substitution therefor.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this List.

Definition.Text: Guide means A Guide to Canada’s Export Control List – December 2018, published by the Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development. (Guide)

Wassenaar Arrangement means the Wassenaar Arrangement on Export Controls for Conventional Arms and Dual-Use Goods and Technologies that was reached at the Plenary Meeting in Vienna, Austria, held on July 11 and 12, 1996, and amended by WA-LIST (18) 1 at the Plenary Meeting in Vienna, Austria, held on December 5 and 6, 2018. (Accord de Wassenaar)

Section.Text: The following goods and technology, when intended for export to the destinations specified, are subject to export control for the purposes set out in section 3 of the Export and Import Permits Act:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: goods and technology referred to in Groups 1, 2, 6, and 7 of the schedule, except for goods and technology set out in items 2-1, 2-2.a. and 2-2.b., 2-3, 2-4.a., 6-1, 6-2, 7-2, 7-3, 7-12 and 7-13 of the Guide, that are intended for export to any destination other than the United States;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: goods and technology referred to in Groups 3, 4 and 9 of the schedule and goods and technology set out in items 2-1, 2-2.a., 2-2.b., 2-3, 2-4.a., 6-1, 6-2, 7-3 and 7-13 of the Guide that are intended for export to any destination;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: goods and technology referred to in Group 5 of the schedule that are intended for export to any destination referred to in the item of the schedule in which the goods or technology is described; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: goods and technology set out in items 7-2 and 7-12 of the Guide that are intended for export to any destination referred to in the item of the Guide in which the goods or technology is described.

Provision.Text: Goods and technology, as described in Group 1 of the Guide, the export of which Canada has agreed to control in accordance with the Wassenaar Arrangement.
The following goods and technology:

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: goods and technology, as described in Group 2 of the Guide, the export of which Canada has agreed to control in accordance with the Wassenaar Arrangement and the Inter-American Convention Against the Illicit Manufacturing of and Trafficking in Firearms, Ammunition, Explosives and other Related Materials; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: firearms described in item 2-1.e. of the Guide.
Goods and technology, as described in Group 3 of the Guide, the export of which Canada has agreed to control

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: under the Treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons that was signed by Canada at London and Washington on July 23, 1968 and at Moscow on July 29, 1968 and that came into force for Canada on March 5, 1970; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: in accordance with the procedures referred to in the Guidelines for Nuclear Transfers (INFCIRC/254/Rev.13/Part 1a), issued by the Nuclear Suppliers Group and adopted at the Plenary Meeting held on June 14 and 15, 2018.
Goods and technology, as described in Group 4 of the Guide, the export of which Canada has agreed to control

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: under the Treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons that was signed by Canada at London and Washington on July 23, 1968 and at Moscow on July 29, 1968 and that came into force for Canada on March 5, 1970; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: in accordance with the procedures referred to in the Guidelines for Transfers of Nuclear-Related Dual-Use Equipment, Materials, Software, and Related Technology (INFCIRC/254/Rev.10/Part 2a), issued by the Nuclear Suppliers Group and adopted at the Plenary Meeting held on June 14 and 15, 2018.
Logs of all species of wood. (All destinations)
Pulpwood of all species of wood. (All destinations)
Blocks, bolts, blanks, boards and any other material or product of red cedar that is suitable for use in the manufacture of shakes or shingles. (All destinations)

Softwood lumber products, as described in Annex 1A to the Softwood Lumber Agreement Between the Government of Canada and the Government of the United States of America, signed on September 12, 2006, as it read on October 12, 2015, excluding those that are described in paragraphs 3 to 5 of that Annex 1A. (United States)
Paragraph 5 of that Annex 1A is to be read without reference to the requirement set out in item (e) of that paragraph.

The references to the Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States (HTSUS) tariff classifications in that Annex 1A are to be read as references to the corresponding Canadian tariff classifications set out in Annex 1B to the agreement referred to in subsection (1).

The references to “imported”, “importer” and “importation” in that Annex 1A are to be read as “exported”, “exporter” and “exportation”, respectively, and the reference to “importés” in the French version of that Annex 1B is to be read as “exportés”.

Skim milk powders that are classified under subheading 0402.10, milk protein concentrates that are classified under subheading 0404.90 and infant formulas containing more than 10% on a dry weight basis of cow’s milk solids that are classified under subheading 1901.10 of the Harmonized Commodity Description and Coding System 2017. (All destinations)
Peanut butter that is classified under tariff item No. 2008.11.10 in the List of Tariff Provisions set out in the schedule to the Customs Tariff. (United States)
Sugar-containing products as follows:

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: products classified under subheadings 1701.91.54, 1704.90.74, 1806.20.75, 1806.20.95, 1806.90.55, 1901.10.74, 1901.90.69, 2101.12.54, 2101.20.54, 2106.90.78 and 2106.90.95 of the Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States (2020), as amended from time to time (United States), for export to the United States within the share of the in-quota quantity of the sugar-containing products tariff rate quota allocated to Canada by the United States in accordance with subparagraph 2(b) of Article 3.A.5 of Annex 3-A of Chapter 3 of CUSMA; and
Sugars, syrups and molasses as follows:

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: sugars, syrups and molasses classified under subheadings 1701.12.10, 1701.91.10, 1701.99.10, 1702.90.10 and 2106.90.44 of the Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States (2020), as amended from time to time (United States), for export to the United States within the share of the in-quota quantity of the refined sugar tariff rate quota allocated to Canada by the United States in accordance with subparagraph 2(a) of Article 3.A.5 of Annex 3-A of Chapter 3 of CUSMA; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: sugars, syrups and molasses classified under subheadings 1701.12.50, 1701.13.50, 1701.14.50, 1701.91.30, 1701.99.50 and 1702.90.20 of the Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States (2020), as amended from time to time (United States), for export to the United States within the Canada-specific tariff rate quota set out in paragraph 14 of Appendix 2: Tariff Schedule of the United States – (Tariff Rate Quotas) to Annex 2-B of Chapter 2 of CUSMA.

High-sugar-containing products classified under subheadings ex 1302.20, ex 1806.10, ex 1806.20, ex 2101.12, ex 2101.20 and ex 2106.90 of Annex 5-A to Annex 5 of the Protocol on Rules of Origin and Origin Procedures of CETA (Annex 5-A), containing 65 percent or more by net weight of added cane or beet sugar classified under subheadings 1701.91 to 1701.99 of Annex 5-A, for export to an EU country or other CETA beneficiary that

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: originate in Canada and comply with the product description and sufficient production criteria referred to in Table A.1 of Annex 5-A;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: contain cane or beet sugar that has been refined exclusively in Canada;

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: are not included in another item in this List; and

Provision.Label: (d)
Provision.Text: are eligible for tariff elimination in accordance with the schedules in Annex 2-A of CETA.

Sugar confectionery and chocolate preparations classified under headings and subheadings 17.04, 1806.31, 1806.32 and 1806.90 of Annex 5-A to Annex 5 of the Protocol on Rules of Origin and Origin Procedures of CETA (Annex 5-A) for export to an EU country or other CETA beneficiary that

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: originate in Canada and comply with the product description and sufficient production criteria referred to in Table A.2 of Annex 5-A;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: are not included in another item in this List; and

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: are eligible for tariff elimination in accordance with the schedules in Annex 2-A of CETA.

Processed foods classified under headings and subheadings 19.01, ex 1902.11, ex 1902.19, ex 1902.20, ex 1902.30, 1904.10, 1904.20, 1904.90, 19.05, 2009.81, ex 2009.89, 2103.90, ex 2106.10 and ex 2106.90 of Annex 5-A to Annex 5 of the Protocol on Rules of Origin and Origin Procedures of CETA (Annex 5-A) for export to an EU country or other CETA beneficiary that

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: originate in Canada and comply with the product description and sufficient production criteria referred to in Table A.3 of Annex 5-A;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: are not included in another item in this List; and

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: are eligible for tariff elimination in accordance with the schedules in Annex 2-A of CETA.

Dog and cat food classified under subheadings 2309.10 and ex 2309.90 of Annex 5-A to Annex 5 of the Protocol on Rules of Origin and Origin Procedures of CETA (Annex 5-A) for export to an EU country or other CETA beneficiary that

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: originates in Canada and complies with the product description and sufficient production criteria referred to in Table A.4 of Annex 5-A;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: is not included in another item in this List; and

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: is eligible for tariff elimination in accordance with the schedules in Annex 2-A of CETA.

Apparel goods classified under headings and subheadings 6102.30, 61.04, 6108.92, 61.14, 62.01 and 62.05 of Annex 5-A to Annex 5 of the Protocol on Rules of Origin and Origin Procedures of CETA (Annex 5-A) for export to an EU country or other CETA beneficiary that

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: originate in Canada and comply with the product description and sufficient production criteria referred to in Table C.2 of Annex 5-A;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: are not included in another item in this List; and

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: are eligible for tariff elimination in accordance with the schedules in Annex 2-A of CETA.

Vehicles classified under subheadings 8703.21, 8703.22, 8703.23, 8703.24, 8703.31, 8703.32, 8703.33, 8703.80 and 8703.90 of the Council Regulation (EEC) No 2658/87 of 23 July 1987 on the tariff and statistical nomenclature and on the Common Customs Tariff, made by the European Union, for export to an EU country or other CETA beneficiary that

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: originate in Canada and comply with the product description and sufficient production criteria referred to in Table D.1 of Annex 5-A to Annex 5 of the Protocol on Rules of Origin and Origin Procedures of CETA;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: are not included in another item in this List; and

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: are eligible for tariff elimination in accordance with the schedules in Annex 2-A of CETA.

Heading.TitleText: United States Origin Goods and Technology

Provision.Text: All goods and technology of United States origin, unless they are included elsewhere in this List, whether in bond or cleared by the Canada Border Services Agency, other than goods or technology that have been further processed or manufactured outside the United States so as to result in a substantial change in value, form or use of the goods or technology or in the production of new goods or technology. (All destinations other than the United States)

All goods and technology that originate outside Canada that are included in this List, whether in bond or cleared by the Canada Border Services Agency, other than goods or technology that are in transit on a through journey on a billing that originates outside Canada if the billing

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: indicates that the ultimate destination of the goods or technology is a country other than Canada; (All destinations other than the United States) and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: in the case of goods or technology that are shipped from the United States, is accompanied by a certified true copy of the United States Shipper’s Export Declaration, and that Declaration does not contain terms that conflict with those of the billing and is presented to the Canada Border Services Agency. (All destinations other than the United States)

Laser weapons that are specifically designed, as their sole combat function or as one of their combat functions, to cause permanent blindness to the naked eye or the eye with corrective eyesight devices. (All destinations)

Subject to subitem (2), systems, equipment, material, components, software and technology for use in research, development, design, testing, demonstration or training related to nuclear fusion or the construction and operation of a nuclear fusion reactor, including

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: reactor assemblies incorporating toroidal and poloidal field coils; (All destinations)

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: independent electrical and magnet power supply systems; (All destinations)

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: high-power microwave radio frequency systems; (All destinations) and

Provision.Label: (d)
Provision.Text: feedback, control and data acquisition systems. (All destinations)
This item does not apply to data

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: that is contained in published books or periodicals or that is otherwise available to the public; or

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: that has been made available without restrictions on its further dissemination.
Anti-personnel mines as defined in section 2 of the Anti-Personnel Mines Convention Implementation Act. (All destinations)
In this item, development, production, software, spacecraft, technology and use have the same meaning as in the provision entitled “Definitions for Terms in Groups 1 and 2” of the Guide.
Strategic goods and technology as follows:

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: goods and technology referred to in Group 1 of the Guide as follows,

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: global navigation satellite systems receiving equipment referred to in item 1-7.A.5. of the Guide, the associated software referred to in item 1-7.D. of the Guide, and the associated technology referred to in item 1-7.E. of the Guide (All destinations other than the United States), and

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: propulsion and space-related equipment referred to in items 1-9.A.4. to 1-9.A.11. of the Guide, the associated software referred to in item 1-9.D. of the Guide, and the associated technology referred to in item 1-9.E. of the Guide; (All destinations other than the United States)

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: software that is specially designed or modified for the development or use of the goods or technology referred to in paragraphs (d) to (i); (All destinations other than the United States)

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: technology that is specially designed or modified for the development or production of the goods or technology referred to in paragraphs (d) to (i); (All destinations other than the United States)

Provision.Label: (d)
Provision.Text: payloads specially designed or modified for spacecraft, and specially designed components therefor, other than payloads or components that are referred to in Group 1 of the Guide; (All destinations other than the United States)

Provision.Label: (e)
Provision.Text: ground control stations for telemetry and tracking and control of space launch vehicles or spacecraft, and specially designed components therefor; (All destinations other than the United States)

Provision.Label: (f)
Provision.Text: chemiluminescent compounds specially designed or modified for military use, and specially designed components therefor; (All destinations other than the United States)

Provision.Label: (g)
Provision.Text: radiation-hardened microelectronic circuits that meet or exceed all of the following, and specially designed components therefor, namely:

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: a total dose of 5 × 105 Rads (SI),

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: a dose rate upset of 5 × 108 Rads (SI)/sec,

Provision.Label: (iii)
Provision.Text: a neutron dose of 1 × 1014 N/cm2,

Provision.Label: (iv)
Provision.Text: a single event upset of 1 × 10-7 or less error/bit/day, and

Provision.Label: (v)
Provision.Text: single event latch-up free and having a dose rate latch-up of 5 × 108 Rads (SI)/sec or greater; (All destinations other than the United States)

Provision.Label: (h)
Provision.Text: nuclear weapons design and test equipment, namely:

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: any article, material, equipment or device which is specially designed or modified for use in the design, development or fabrication of nuclear weapons or nuclear explosive devices, (All destinations)

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: any article, material, equipment or device which is specially designed or modified for use in the devising, carrying out or evaluating of nuclear weapons tests or other nuclear explosions; (All destinations) and

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: any other articles not specifically set out in paragraphs (a) to (h) or in Group 2 or Group 6 that are United States origin goods or technology, which have been determined under Parts 120 to 130 of Title 22 of the International Traffic in Arms Regulations of the Code of Federal Regulations (United States) as having substantial military applicability, and which have been specially designed or modified for military purposes. (All destinations other than in the United States)

Heading.TitleText: Goods and Technology for Certain Uses

Provision.Text: Goods and technology whether or not included elsewhere on the List if their properties and any information made known to the exporter by any intermediary or final consignee or from any other source would lead a reasonable person to suspect that they will be used

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: in the development, production, handling, operation, maintenance, storage, detection, identification or dissemination of

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: chemical or biological weapons,

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: nuclear explosive or radiological dispersal devices, or

Provision.Label: (iii)
Provision.Text: materials or equipment that could be used in such weapons or devices;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: in the development, production, handling, operation, maintenance or storage of

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: missiles or other systems capable of delivering chemical or biological weapons or nuclear explosive or radiological dispersal devices, or

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: materials or equipment that could be used in such missiles or systems; or

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: in any facility used for any of the activities described in paragraphs (a) and (b).

Goods and technology whether or not included elsewhere on the List if the Minister has determined, on the basis of their properties and any additional information relating to such matters as their intended end-use or the identity or conduct of their intermediary or final consignees, that they are likely to be used in the activities or facilities referred to in subitem (1).
Subitem (1) applies to goods and technology intended for export to all destinations unless

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: they are intended for end-use in Argentina, Australia, Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, the Czech Republic, Denmark, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Italy, Japan, Luxembourg, the Netherlands, New Zealand, Norway, Poland, Portugal, the Republic of Korea, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, Turkey, Ukraine, the United Kingdom or the United States;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: their intermediary consignees, if any, are located in those countries; and

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: their final consignee is located in one of those countries.
Subitem (2) applies to goods and technology intended for export to all destinations.

Goods and technology, as described in Group 6 of the Guide, the export of which Canada has agreed to control under bilateral arrangements concluded on April 7, 1987, in accordance with the Guidelines for Sensitive Missile-Relevant Transfers, issued by the Missile Technology Control Regime to control the export of missile equipment and technology referred to in the MTCR/TEM/2018/Annex of November 30, 2018 that was adopted at the Reinforced Point of Contact Meeting held on December 18 and 19, 2018.
Goods and technology, as described in Group 7 of the Guide, the export of which Canada has agreed to control

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: under a bilateral arrangement concluded on December 24, 1992, between Canada and the United States, this arrangement having been made in accordance with the Guidelines for Transfers of Sensitive Chemical or Biological Items, issued by the Australia Group to control the export of chemical and biological weapons, the list of which was amended at the Plenary Meeting held from June 4 to 8, 2018; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: under the Convention on the Prohibition of the Development, Production, Stockpiling and Use of Chemical Weapons and on Their Destruction, which was signed at Paris, France, on January 13, 1993.

The goods referred to in items 9-1 to 9-9, whether or not included elsewhere in this List, the export of which Canada has agreed to control in accordance with its obligations under the Arms Trade Treaty.
Battle tanks that are tracked or wheeled self-propelled armoured fighting vehicles weighing at least 16.5 t unladen, with a direct fire main gun of at least 75 mm calibre.
Armoured combat vehicles as follows:

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: tracked, semi-tracked or wheeled self-propelled vehicles with armoured protection and cross-country capability having any of the following characteristics:

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: designed or modified and equipped to transport a squad of four or more infantry soldiers,

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: armed with an integral or organic weapon of at least 12.5 mm calibre,

Provision.Label: (iii)
Provision.Text: equipped with a missile launcher,

Provision.Label: (iv)
Provision.Text: equipped with organic technical means for observation, reconnaissance and target indication and designed to perform reconnaissance missions,

Provision.Label: (v)
Provision.Text: equipped with integral or organic technical means for command of troops,

Provision.Label: (vi)
Provision.Text: equipped with integral or organic electronic and technical means designed for electronic warfare; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: armoured bridge-launching vehicles.
Large-calibre artillery systems as follows:

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: guns, howitzers, mortars – and artillery pieces that combine the characteristics of a gun or howitzer – that are capable of engaging surface targets by delivering indirect fire and have

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: a calibre of at least 75 mm but not greater than 155 mm, or

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: a calibre greater than 155 mm;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: multiple-launch rocket systems that are capable of engaging surface targets by delivering indirect fire and have a calibre of at least 75 mm; and

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: gun carriers specially designed for towing artillery.
Military aircraft and related systems as follows:

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: manned fixed-wing or variable-geometry wing aircraft that are designed, equipped or modified to

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: engage targets by employing guided missiles, unguided rockets, bombs, guns, cannons or other weapons of destruction, or

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: perform reconnaissance, command-of-troops, electronic warfare, suppression of air-defence systems, refuelling or airdrop missions;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: unmanned fixed-wing or variable-geometry wing aircraft that are designed, equipped or modified to

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: engage targets by employing guided missiles, unguided rockets, bombs, guns, cannons or other weapons of destruction, or

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: perform reconnaissance, electronic warfare or suppression of air-defence systems missions; and

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: systems for the control and receiving of information from the unmanned aircraft referred to in paragraph (b).
Military helicopters and related systems as follows:

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: manned rotary-wing aircraft that are designed, equipped or modified to

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: engage targets by employing guided or unguided anti-armour, air-to-surface, air-to-subsurface or air-to-air weapons for which the aircraft are equipped with an integrated fire control and aiming system, or

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: perform reconnaissance, electronic warfare, target acquisition (including anti-submarine warfare), communications, command-of-troops or minelaying missions;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: unmanned rotary-wing aircraft that are designed, equipped or modified to

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: engage targets by employing guided or unguided anti-armour, air-to-surface, air-to-subsurface or air-to-air weapons for which the aircraft are equipped with an integrated fire control and aiming system, or

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: perform reconnaissance, electronic warfare or suppression of air-defence systems missions; and

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: systems for the control and receiving of information from the unmanned aircraft referred to in paragraph (b).
Vessels and submarines that are armed and equipped for military use and that

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: have a standard displacement equal to or greater than 150 t; or

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: have a standard displacement of less than 150 t and are equipped for launching missiles or torpedoes with a range of 25 km or greater.
Missiles and missile launchers, as follows:

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: guided or unguided rockets and ballistic or cruise missiles that are capable of delivering a warhead or weapon of destruction to a range of 25 km or greater;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: launchers that are specially designed or modified for launching the missiles or rockets referred to in paragraph (a), if not included in any of items 9-1 to 9-6; and

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: man-portable air-defense systems (MANPADS).
Paragraph (1)(a) includes remotely piloted vehicles that have the characteristics of the missiles or rockets described in that subsection.
Small arms that are destined for police or military end-use by individual members, as follows:

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: handguns that

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: are automatic or converted automatic in function,

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: are semi-automatic in function, or

Provision.Label: (iii)
Provision.Text: are revolvers;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: rifles other than those specified in paragraph (d);

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: submachine guns that are automatic or converted automatic in function;

Provision.Label: (d)
Provision.Text: assault rifles that are automatic or converted automatic in function; and

Provision.Label: (e)
Provision.Text: light machine guns that

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: are automatic or converted automatic in function, and

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: have a calibre of 12.7mm or less,
Subsection (1) does not include

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: firearms that are specially designed for dummy or blank ammunition and are incapable of discharging a projectile or marking cartridges;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: firearms that are specially designed for marking or for force-on-force type training ammunition;

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: firearms that are specially designed to launch tethered projectiles having no high-explosive charge or communications link to a range of 500 m or less; or

Provision.Label: (d)
Provision.Text: antique firearms as defined in subsection 84(1) of the Criminal Code.
Light weapons destined for use by individual members of armed or security forces or by several members serving as a crew and delivering primarily direct fire as follows:

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: heavy machine guns, other than the grenade launchers specified in paragraph (b), that

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: are automatic or converted automatic in function, and

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: have a calibre greater than 12.7 mm;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: hand-held grenade launchers, under-barrel-mounted grenade launchers and mounted grenade launchers;

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: portable anti-tank guns;

Provision.Label: (d)
Provision.Text: recoilless rifles;

Provision.Label: (e)
Provision.Text: portable anti-tank missile launchers and rocket systems; and

Provision.Label: (f)
Provision.Text: mortars that have a calibre less than 75 mm.
Subsection (1) does not include antique firearms, as defined in subsection 84(1) of the Criminal Code.
